pullRequest.body:
* Also redefine `MDifferentiableWithinAt` and `MDifferentiableAt` so that they are using `LiftProp[Within]At`.
* This causes a speedup in the old proof of `ContMDiffWithinAt.cle_arrowCongr` by 25%.
* Also give some extra information in the proof of `ContMDiffWithinAt.cle_arrowCongr` to speed it up by another factor of 4.
* A bit of the fallout (e.g. in `hasSmoothAddSelf`) is from Lean unfolding *way* too many definitions to make things definitionally equal. Since `LiftPropWithinAt` is now a structure, the old proofs now break, unless you rewrite with `chartedSpaceSelf_prod`), causing much less defeq-abuse.
* The new lemmas `MDifferentiableWithinAt.differentiableWithinAt_writtenInExtChartAt` and `MDifferentiableAt.differentiableWithinAt_writtenInExtChartAt` have a bit long names. This is to avoid naming clash with the existing `MDifferentiableWithinAt.differentiableWithinAt`. I'm open for other suggestions.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Out of curiousity:

!bench

> Out of curiousity:
> 
> !bench

What happened here?
!bench

I think the problem was that I pushed another commit, causing the CI to fail. 

I'm not quite sure under what conditions that bot triggers. Does `!bench` need to be its own message? Does the CI need to have already passed at the time of writing the command?

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/61fb033f-f777-4b0f-8b9a-3385dca5dd48) for commit b00ca0d635dbbb92cf3c64e6a70ed83dff22bce0.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/87394429-2db1-4497-867b-7f52e8bd9b80/to/61fb033f-f777-4b0f-8b9a-3385dca5dd48) against commit 333b54aedc839303747a125277e576a12d956d81:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.ContMDiff.NormedSpace   instructions   -25.6%
```

Thanks! 

bors merge

I have a memory of writing a multi-line comment and it working fine. CI is independent from the benchmark bot. It just builds mathlib and runs the linters on the server. (Useful as you can `sorry` large parts to gauge performance.)

I was hoping for slightly more performance improvements. 
I think making things irreducible mostly speeds broken proofs up, and helps a lot less with working proofs. I think the actual gain is only from the change in ContMDiffWithinAt.cle_arrowCongr. Oh well...
Sometimes you need to operate from principles alone :)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8898183469/job/24434765833)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8898183469/job/24434765363)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8898183469/job/24434764555)
Thanks a lot for picking this up - I had noticed (and being annoyed several times) at `ContMDiff/NormedSpace` being very slow. I have only minor comments.
Is this change needed? Reading just the source, I would think that `constructor` creates two sub-goals, each line solves one, and you could condense them as the original proof.

The only thing that changed here is adding `chartedSpaceSelf_prod` as a rewrite step. This is indeed necessary, see PR message. I just prefer this style over the original style (which goes term mode -> tactic mode -> term mode).
:bulb: Right... and you have a point. Then my only request is to use focus the two sub-goals.
There are never two separate goals (see original proof)
`SmoothAdd` has only one field that is not solved by type-class inference.
So my mental model of constructor was wrong. (Reading the documentation, that indeed makes sense!) Thanks for pointing this out; sorry for the noise.
Should the `by` go on the previous line?

```suggestion
  rw [MDifferentiableAt, liftPropAt_iff]
Note to self/other reviewers: these two lemmas moved to `Defs`

Expanding `.1` and `.2`  into e.g. `differentiableWithinAt_writtenInExtChartAt` makes the code *much* more verbose, but also more explicit. I'm not sure which one I prefer, but I don't have a strong opinion either way.
I wouldn't mind picking a shorter lemma name, but I don't have a particular idea either.
see PR message. I also wouldn't mind a shorter name.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - perf: make LocalInvariantProp a structure
